result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dashawn Cornlious Currin

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Services Status Report - 10-17-2022, filed.

Defendant Dashawn Cornlious Currin appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Dashawn Cornlious Currin.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State and requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Dashawn Cornlious Currin appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Dashawn Cornlious Currin. Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dashawn Cornlious Currin in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 06-02-2022, filed.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver, filed.

Defendant Dashawn Cornlious Currin in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 04-21-2022, filed.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Court waives the defendant's appearance for the purpose of today's proceedings. Defense requests a preliminary hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 03-30-2022, filed.

Defendant Dashawn Cornlious Currin in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 02-24-2022, filed.
22RM002639  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 1/26/2022
Preliminary hearing on February 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dashawn Cornlious Currin in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 01-21-2022, filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.A. and S.W.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with GPS supervision for 24 hour monitoring with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $10,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dashawn Cornlious Currin in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dashawn Cornlious Currin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
